programme.title: Live - Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Coverage of the opening day's play at the All England Club, as this year's championships get under way in the men's and ladies' singles. The third Grand Slam event of the year on the hallowed grass courts is always one of the highlights of the sporting calendar, and the seeded players may be at risk of upsets as they acclimatise to the conditions after playing on clay for so long, although there were relatively few shocks on the opening day last year. Novak Djokovic began proceedings on Centre Court with a straight-sets victory against British wildcard James Ward, and there were also wins for former Wimbledon champions Roger Federer, Venus Williams and current world number one Angelique Kerber

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Highlights of the opening day's play at the All England Club, where the first round got under way in the men's and ladies' singles. Much of the attention will have been on the opening match on Centre Court, which saw Andy Murray begin the defence of his title, as he aims to triumph for a third time at SW19. The bottom half of the women's draw also started, with the draw wide open in the absence of defending champion Serena Williams

programme.title: Live - Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Coverage as the second day's play at the All England Club gets under way, with the first round in the men's and ladies' singles set to continue. Weather permitting, the line-up for the second round will be decided by the end of the day, with the bottom half of the men's draw and the top half of the ladies' taking place today. Day two traditionally sees the defending ladies' champion begin the defence of her title, but Serena Williams is absent this year due to pregnancy, leaving the draw wide open. Andy Murray was among the victors on day two last year as he began a campaign that would ultimately end in triumph, beating fellow Brit Liam Broady in straight sets, while there were also wins for Stan Wawrinka, Nick Kyrgios and Richard Gasquet in the men's draw(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Highlights of the first-round matches on day two at the All England Club, where the third Grand Slam tournament of the year continued on the grass courts. Fifteen British players entered the main draw last year, but only five made it through to the second round, including eventual men's champion Andy Murray. Plus, a look ahead to tomorrow's order of play(n)

programme.desc: V najštevilčnejši državi na planetu iz leta v letu več vlagajo v nogomet. V Kitajski prvi ligi tako najdemo številna ugledna imena, kot so Jackson Martinez, Teixiera, Ramires, Gervinho, Ezequiel Lavezzi in ostali, ki dvigujejo raven kakovosti kitajskega nogometa. V leta 2004 ustanovljeni Super ligi se meri 16 moštev, aktualni prvaki prihajajo iz vrste Guangzhou Evergrande, ki so s šestimi naslovi hkrati tudi najuspešnejše moštvo

programme.desc: Wimbledonska sveta trava je znova v ospredju zanimanja teniških ljubiteljev, saj je na sporedu tretji letošnji turnir za grand slam, ki velja hkrati tudi za najprestižnejšega v teniškem svetu. Pri dekletih je bila pred letom dni najboljša Serena Williams, ki zaradi nosečnosti ne bo branila zmage, zato je lov na sveti gral odprt, pri moških naslov brani domači matador Andy Murray. programme.title: Spanish league - special: Promoted teams
programme.desc: Španska nogometna liga, bolj poznana pod vzdevkom La Liga, je najelitnejše nogometno tekmovanje v Španiji. Ustanovljena je bila leta 1929. V ligi nastopa 20 klubov, kjer vsako sezono nekdo postane prvak in izpade v špansko drugo ligo. Najuspešnejša kluba sta madridski Real in Barcelona. Skupaj sta ligo osvojila kar 56-krat. Zadnji naslov je romal v roke madridskega Reala

programme.desc: Segunda division (od leta 2008 naprej Liga Adelante; v prevodu pomeni »Liga naprej«) je bila ustanovljena leta 1929 in je druga najmočnejša nogometna liga v Španiji. V njej nastopa 22 klubov. Iz Segunde vsako leto trije najboljši klubu napredujejo v Primero Division, štirje najslabši pa izpadejo v Segundo Division B

programme.title: Prijateljska tekma legend: Barcelona - Manchester United
programme.desc: Legende Barcelone in Manchester Uniteda obljubljajo veliko zabave in atraktivnih potez, ki jih morda pogrešamo na tistih najbolj pomembnih tekmah. Izid bo tokrat v drugem planu, brez dvoma pa nas čaka izjemna nogometna predstava

programme.title: Kitajska liga: Jiangsu - Shanghai SIPG
programme.desc: V najštevilčnejši državi na planetu iz leta v letu več vlagajo v nogomet. V Kitajski prvi ligi tako najdemo številna ugledna imena, kot so Jackson Martinez, Teixiera, Ramires, Gervinho, Ezequiel Lavezzi in ostali, ki dvigujejo raven kakovosti kitajskega nogometa. V leta 2004 ustanovljeni Super ligi se meri 16 moštev, aktualni prvaki prihajajo iz vrste Guangzhou Evergrande, ki so s šestimi naslovi hkrati tudi najuspešnejše moštvo

programme.title: Europa League - 1. predRound: Domžale - Flora Talin
programme.desc: Domžalčani kot aktualni slovenski pokalni zmagovalci z nastopi v evropskih pokalih začenjajo v prvem krogu kvalifikacij za Evropsko ligo, kjer jih čaka estonska Flora. Ekipa iz Talina je spoštovanja vredna ekipa, vseeno pa so izbranci Simona Rožmana v rahli vlogi favorita. Bodo to potrdili tudi na igrišču? Z dobrim izidom na prvi tekmi bi si močno olajšali delo pred povratno tekmo na gostujočem terenu

programme.title: Svetovna liga, 2. skupina - Finale: Slovenija - Japonska
programme.desc: Slovenska odbojkarska reprezentanca je na krilih Mitje Gasparinija v polfinalu zaključnega turnirja v Avstraliji odpihnila Nizozemsko, ki ni niti v enem trenutku ogrozila zmago izbrancev Slobodana Kovača. Slovence v finalu čaka Japonska, ki je v drugem polfinalu z zmago proti Avstraliji utišala domače navijače, vendarle pa se zdi, da bo našo reprezentanco težko presenetila

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: The story of football's Manning family, focusing not only on the careers of Ole Miss star Archie and his NFL sons Peyton and Eli, but on the sudden death of Archie's father and its impact on his approach to fatherhood. Olivia and oldest son Cooper also appear, along with numerous friends and relatives. John Goodman narrates. (repeat) (cc)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Wide receiver Randy Moss is profiled by filmmaker Marquis Daisy in a journey back to the small town of Rand, W.Va., where troubles with the law nealry derailed Moss's career before he landed at Marshall and began making national headlines on the field. (repeat) (cc)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: A look at the on-going relationship between LSU basketball icons Shaquille O'Neal and Dale Brown, who spent 1989-92 together in Baton Rouge after first meeting in Germany when Shaq was 13. Narrated by Louisiana native Tim McGraw. (repeat) (cc)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Chronicling Oklahoma Sooners star Brian Bosworth's days as "The Boz" under football coach Barry Switzer. Both men reflect on their father-son relationship in three memorable seasons (1984-86) in Norman, while also discussing how their lives have changed. Directed by Thaddeus D. Matula. (repeat) (cc)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The rise of sports-marketing pioneer Sonny Vaccaro, who was instrumental in launching Nike's "Air Jordan" empire in the '80s and ushered in a new era of high-school hoops in the '90s. Interviews include Larry Brown, Brandon Jennings and Tracy McGrady. Directed by Jon Weinbach and Dan Marks. (repeat) (cc)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: An in-depth profile of polarizing Duke basketball great Christian Laettner, the only player to start in four consecutive Final Fours. Rory Karpf directs a "gloves-off" examination of the man who has been seen by many as the "Blue Devil Himself." (repeat) (cc)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Polarizing football coach Bill McCartney and his revitalization of the Colorado Buffaloes is chronicled, examining off-the-field lows as well as the high of a 1990 national title. McCartney was founder of the Promise Keepers, a Christian men's ministry. Directed by Jim Podhoretz. (repeat) (cc)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Chronicling the rise and fall of Pete Carroll's reign as USC Trojans football coach, featuring three Heisman winners (later cut to two), a 34-game win streak and the pivotal 2006 Rose Bowl against Texas. Directed by Aaron Rahsaan Thomas. (repeat) (cc)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Chronicling LSU's dramatic 1996 College World Series win on a championship-game walk-off home run by diminutive infielder Warren Morris. Director Kenan K. Holley revisits one of college baseball's signature moments, 20 years later. (repeat) (cc)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: A 10-year retrospective on the 2006 Duke lacrosse case in which three players were charged with rape, only to have all charges dropped a year later. Director Marina Zenovich explores the case's hot-button issues of sex, race, class and violence, and the turbulent period's lasting impact on the players and the program. (repeat) (cc)

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Chronicling Jerry Jones and Jimmy Johnson in their days as Arkansas football teammates--part of an undefeated national champion squad in 1964--long before joining forces to win two Super Bowls with the Dallas Cowboys. Directed by Corey Frost. (repeat) (cc)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The high-flying Houston Cougars basketball squad of the early '80s is chronicled, featuring Hakeem Olajuwon, Clyde Drexler and others from Guy Lewis's three straight Final Four teams. Also: role player Benny Anders' disappearance. Directed by Chip Rives. (repeat) (cc)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Chronicling the career of Hall of Fame basketball coach John Calipari, an accomplished yet controversial figure who has embraced the era of one-year stays by top college players. Marcus Camby, Derrick Rose and Anthony Davis are among those interviewed by director Jonathan Hock. (repeat) (cc)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The epic 1988 Miami-Notre Dame football matchup is chronicled by director Patrick Creadon, a Notre Dame senior that year with unique insight into the game's controversial t-shirt. Players and coaches reflect on the emotionally-charged day in South Bend. (repeat) (cc)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: "The U" chronicles the 1980s evolution of University of Miami football. Miami native and school alum Billy Corben examines how the team's success and swagger related to racial and cultural changes on the campus and in the city. (repeat) (cc)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Chronicling University of Miami football from the low of NCAA sanctions in the mid-'90s to the high of the 2001 National Championship; to the new controversy of a booster's Ponzi scheme to win favor with the program. Directed by Billy Corben. (repeat) (cc)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The rise, fall and rebirth of SMU football is chronicled in "Pony Exce$$." Craig James and Eric Dickerson highlighted the Mustangs' heyday of the early '80s, but rules violations led to the program's demise in 1987. Directed by Thaddeus D. Matula, a graduate of SMU's film school. (repeat) (cc)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Chronicling Youngstown (Pa.) natives Jim Tressel and Maurice Clarett, who both made inglorious exits from Ohio State football following on-field success. Jim Brown and ex-Buckeyes QB Craig Krenzel are featured. Directed by Jeff and Michael Zimbalist. (repeat) (cc)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Chronicling the origin of the Big East Conference and its rapid 1980s rise under commissioner Dave Gavitt and iconic basketball coaches including John Thompson, Lou Carnesecca and Jim Boeheim. programme.title: Into High Country
programme.desc: Jason bowhunts his home state of Montana for bull elk. After a few days of finding nothing, Jason has an encounter with the biggest bull of his life

programme.title: Pure Hunting
programme.desc: Will Schmidt heads to his property in Nebraska for a last-minute, self-filmed whitetail hunt. The area had been hit hard by EHD in previous years so he's hoping the quality of bucks has improved

programme.title: Sheep Shape
programme.desc: Chad and Rick arrive in British Columbia to pursue Stone sheep and moose

programme.title: The Western Hunter

programme.title: Guns & Gear
programme.desc: Hitting the range with the latest releases: Sig Sauer rifles and the XD-E from Springfield Armory. Also: check out the new Founder Series holsters from CrossBreed Holsters, tactical clothing from Propper; Liberty Safe handgun vaults and more

programme.title: Guns & Ammo TV
programme.desc: Starting From Scratch highlights the R&D process for bringing new firearms, ammo and optics/accessories to market. Suppressors 101 covers everything from A-to-Z on this red-hot category

programme.title: GunVenture
programme.desc: Tom and Ryan head north for some scattergun fun. While one heads to South Dakota for a pheasant hunt, the other heads to Michigan to rouse some grouse. Also: a custom-fitting with Dr. Shotgun for Tom and a fun drive in a 1973 fire truck for Ryan

programme.title: Monster Bucks
programme.desc: Travel back in time as David Blanton takes a look back on Monster Bucks 1 & 2

programme.title: Moment of Impact

programme.title: Petersen's Hunting Adventures

programme.title: Gallery of Guns

programme.title: Handguns And Defensive Weapons
programme.desc: Rich and Jim cover guns, ammo and more for the AR-15; the guys talk carry-gun break-in; and they debate the merits of 9mm vs. .45 ACP in the 1911 pistol
